Usage
=====

Below a number of usage examples are presented.

Please note that SeleShot always takes screen of a whole website,
even if *id* or *xpath* is specified.

Command line
------------

* Screen of searchbox (element with attribute id = *searchbox*)

    .. code-block:: bash

        python seleshot.py -u http://www.python.org/ -i searchbox

* Screens of two elements (*content-panel* and *left-panel*), ids is separated by space

    .. code-block:: bash

        python seleshot.py -u http://www.kinyen.pl/ -i content-panel left-panel

* Screen of menu elements by using *xpath*

    .. code-block:: bash

        python seleshot.py -u http://www.python.org/ -x ".//*[@id='menu']/ul/li"

* Multiple screens of menu elements using *xpath* (elements are separated by a space)

    .. code-block:: bash

        python seleshot.py -u http://www.python.org/ -x ".//*[@id='menu']/ul/li[1]" ".//*[@id='menu']/ul/li[2]"

Standalone application
----------------------

The code below shows how to create a simple application which takes a screen shot of a webpage.

.. code-block:: python

    from seleshot import create

    s = create()
    s.get_screen(url="http://www.python.org", ids = ["searchbox"])
    s.close()

Selenium tests
--------------

The code below shows how to create a test which takes a screen shot of a webpage.

.. code-block:: python

    from seleshot import create

    class Test(unittest.TestCase):
        def setUp(self):
            self.s = seleshot.create()

        def tearDown(self):
            self.s.close()

        def test_get_data(self):
            self.s.get_data('http://www.kinyen.pl/', 'ALL', 'dump.txt')

Webdriver Remote
----------------

To use selenium-server-standalone you have to provide url where the server is located

* Screen of searchbox (element with attribute id = *searchbox*) but webdriver is located on *selenium-server-standalone*

    .. code-block:: bash

        python seleshot.py -u http://www.python.org/ -i searchbox -r http://127.0.0.1:4444/wd/hub

* Screen of menu elements with specified *xpath* and url to *selenium-server-standalone*

    .. code-block:: bash

        python seleshot.py -u http://www.python.org/ -x ".//*[@id='menu']/ul/li" -r http://127.0.0.1:4444/wd/hub
